quote_first: By the first week of May, Ralph was waking up to birdsong at
quote_last: He tried earplugs for a few nights, although he doubted from the outset that they would work. It wasn’t the newly returned birds that were waking him up, nor the occasional delivery-truck backfire out on Harris Avenue. He had always been the sort of guy who could sleep in the middle of a brass marching bad, and he didn’t think that had changed. What had changed was inside his head.
title: Insomnia
author: Stephen King

title: Fear and Loathing: On the Campaign Trail '72
author: Hunter S Thompson
